title: Bybit Earn Pilots OpenAPI Integration into Flexible Savings
body: DUBAI, UAE, Feb. 26, 2025 /PRNewswire/ — Bybit , the world’s second-largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume, is enhancing trading features and seamless experiences by introducing the OpenAPI functionality on Bybit Earn. Available now for Flexible Savings products on Bybit Earn, the upgrade will help users make better informed decisions faster, and offer an unobstructed view of their asset performance in their own preferred set-up. The OpenAPI integration supports multiple trading and data point extraction scenarios, marking an advancement in automated asset management capabilities for users of Flexible Savings on Bybit Earn . What it means: Users now have the option to programmatically manage their Bybit Earn Flexible Savings positions through API endpoints, significantly improving efficiency for institutional clients and professional traders who manage multiple positions. Feature Highlights: Staking & Redemption: Users can now create staking and redemption orders more efficiently using the API. The API integration supports both Unified Trading Accounts (UTA) and Funding Accounts, enabling users to personalize their asset management style. This means users can integrate Bybit Earn Flexible Savings directly into their automated trading strategies or portfolio management tools. Information Queries: Users can easily query their orders, positions, and product details (such as the maximum staking limit and estimated APR) via the API. This feature also allows for real-time data retrieval, enabling users to make informed decisions quickly. For example, a user can programmatically check the current APR of a Flexible Savings product and adjust their staking strategy accordingly. “This integration is another step forward in our mission to provide institutional-grade trading and earning capabilities for high-calibre users,” said Joan Han, Sales and Marketing Director at Bybit . “By extending API functionality to our Flexible Savings product, we continue to meet the users’ increasing demands for more powerful tool to optimize their yield strategies.” Availability and Documentation The initial release starts with the Flexible Savings product suite, with potential expansion to other Earn products planned for future updates. The integration is supported by detailed API documentation and technical resources to ensure smooth implementation for users, available through Bybit’s official API documentation portal. Users may find out more at: https://bybit-exchange.github.io/docs/v5/earn/product-info #Bybit / #TheCryptoArk About Bybit Bybit is the world’s second-largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume, serving a global community of over 60 million users. Founded in 2018, Bybit is redefining openness in the decentralized world by creating a simpler, open and equal ecosystem for everyone. With a strong focus on Web3, Bybit partners strategically with leading blockchain protocols to provide robust infrastructure and drive on-chain innovation. Renowned for its secure custody, diverse marketplaces, intuitive user experience, and advanced blockchain tools, Bybit bridges the gap between TradFi and DeFi, empowering builders, creators, and enthusiasts to unlock the full potential of Web3. Discover the future of decentralized finance at Bybit.com . For more details about Bybit, please visit Bybit Press For media inquiries, please contact: media@bybit.com For updates, please follow: Bybit’s Communities and Social Media Discord | Facebook | Instagram | LinkedIn | Reddit | Telegram | TikTok | X | Youtube

title: Jupiter begins first JUP buyback worth $3.33M
body: Jupiter has officially begun its first JUP token buyback, with on-chain data confirming that 4.88 million JUP worth $3.33 million have already been repurchased. The Feb. 26 buyback was reported on X by popular on-chain analyst AI姨, who flagged Jupiter’s ( JUP ) Litterbox address used for all buyback transactions. The buyback is the first step in Jupiter’s larger strategy to repurchase JUP tokens with 50% of protocol fees. https://twitter.com/ai_9684xtpa/status/1894587658359509255?s=46&t=nznXkss3debX8JIhNzHmzw The buyback initiative, which was unveiled on Feb. 13, intends to reduce the number of tokens in circulation by locking repurchased tokens for three years and generating consistent buying pressure. The cryptocurrency community has welcomed the move, viewing it as a net positive that will boost demand and prevent JUP from becoming a “value trap.” You might also like: LIBRA’s collapse becomes Solana’s biggest scandal since FTX: How Jupiter and Meteora left retail rekt Jupiter is projected to spend about $50 million on JUP buybacks this year, based on its $102 million revenue in 2024. These buybacks would represent about 2.7% of JUP’s $1.8 billion market capitalization. Jupiter has continued to hold its spot as Solana’s top DEX aggregator. The protocol generates fees by directing trades among many DEXs, such as Raydium and Orca, and ensuring that traders receive the best exchange rates. In the past year, Jupiter’s revenue has increased significantly as a result of the memecoin trading frenzy on Solana. The Jupiter Perps trading platform, which holds over 80% of Solana’s perpetual decentralized exchange market, has been another key contributor to Jupiter’s revenue growth. In 2024, revenue increased sharply from $3 million in January to $21 million in December, according to on- chain analyst AI姨. Almost 40% of Jupiter’s total revenue for the year, or $35.86 million, came from fees during significant trading periods, including the spike in TRUMP memecoin trading. Jupiter’s buyback initiative is in line with a larger DeFi trend in which protocols such as Aave ( AAVE ) and Ethena ( ENA ) are implementing token value-accrual methods. Although the long-term effects are yet to be seen, the buyback initiative shows an increasing emphasis on aligning tokenholder value with protocol growth. title: Is BlackRock Selling Bitcoin (BTC)?
body: The recent Bitcoin (BTC) price struggles have led to people carefully monitoring every event around the market, which could affect its performance. Of these, BlackRock selling news is gaining the most attention, as reports suggest that it has transferred millions of assets to Coinbase Prime. Investors fear further market crashes, so what’s happening? Let’s discuss. BlackRock Bitcoin Transfer Gives Chills to Investors BlackRock is a renowned asset custodian and issuer of the IBIT ETF. As a custodian, it holds assets on behalf of investors and often conducts transactions for various purposes. However, its recent transfer of 1,800 BTC ($160M) to Coinbase Prime puts it in a tough spot, as investors understand it as a possible sell-off. Along with the BTC transfer, the ETF provider also transferred 18,168 ETH ($44M), bringing the total to $204M. Meanwhile, the Bitcoin price crashed to $88.16k , adding extra fears among investors and speculation about selling. This is because a move to the exchange wallet often results in selling. However, that is not the case here. This is because, as a custodian, this ETF manager cannot directly buy or sell the asset. It actually holds assets on behalf of the ETF investors. More importantly, analysts believe this move does not indicate a sale. Instead, it could be related to portfolio rebalancing, redemptions, or operational adjustments within the fund. BlackRock Selling More of ETF Outflows This asset manager is grabbing investors’ attention with $204M worth of asset transfers on February 25 within a short time. Interestingly, these events happened amid the broader ETF market outflows, where the Bitcoin ETFs saw a single-day exit of $937.9M. Here, the Coinglass report reveals Fidelity ETF (FBTC) witnessed the most significant outflow of the day, at $344.7M, and IBIT came next with $164.4M, which many considered selling. Considering BlackRock holding of 584.789K BTC (2.6% of the total supply), including the $50 billion worth of token purchases in 2024 alone, investors’ concerns are considerable. If they begin selling, the crypto market crash will accelerate severely. However, this is less likely to happen, especially as this asset manager is a pro-crypto supporter. Its CEO, Larry Fink, predicts that BTC price could hit $700,000 if sovereign wealth funds allocate a small percentage of their assets to the cryptocurrency. Conclusion: No, They Are Not Selling Bitcoin Despite speculation and investor concerns, it is clear that this asset manager is not selling BTC. Though the transfers were present, that could be a part of redemptions or rebalancing, as the asset manager has done the same before multiple times. Additionally, the firm has long held a positive stance on crypto and believed in its continuous growth, even to as high as $700,000, so the selling outcome is less likely. Amid these speculations, the Bitcoin price is still volatile, trading at $88.3k after an 8% drop last week. Investors should focus on their strategies in this volatile market rather than panicking over wallet transfers. The post Is BlackRock Selling Bitcoin (BTC)? appeared first on CoinGape .

title: BlockDAG’s Developer Grants & Testnet Open Doors for Smart Contract Deployment—Apply Now!
body: BlockDAG is making bold moves to strengthen its developer ecosystem, as outlined in its latest AMA on February 20, 2025. The team revealed a structured plan to provide education, financial incentives, and integration opportunities for developers looking to build on the network. With nearly $200 million raised in its presale, BlockDAG is using this momentum to fuel adoption by ensuring builders have the resources they need to create impactful decentralized applications. Developer Grants and Financial Support One of the key takeaways from the AMA was BlockDAG’s introduction of a developer grants program. The initiative will allocate funding ranging from $10,000 to $100,000, depending on the scope and potential impact of each project. The grants will be distributed in BDAG tokens and USDT, providing flexibility for builders who need immediate liquidity while still maintaining a vested interest in the network’s success. The funding aims to support projects in DeFi, gaming, NFTs, and cross-chain applications, ensuring a diverse range of use cases that can leverage BlockDAG’s capabilities. This financial backing is set to encourage early-stage developers and established teams alike to experiment and contribute to the ecosystem. Tutorials and Learning Resources BlockDAG is also focused on education, recognizing that onboarding developers requires more than just incentives. The BlockDAG Academy, spearheaded by Marcus Xavier, will roll out a structured learning platform covering blockchain fundamentals, smart contract development, and network-specific tools. Educational content will be divided into three levels: General Blockchain Knowledge – Covers key concepts, security practices, and wallet management. BlockDAG-Specific Training – Focuses on how to interact with BlockDAG’s architecture and smart contract framework. Advanced Development – Provides guidance on building, testing, and deploying decentralized applications (dApps) on BlockDAG. The academy will integrate with platforms like GitHub and online coding communities to streamline learning and collaboration. Encouraging Smart Contract Deployment on Testnet With the upcoming testnet beta set to launch in March, BlockDAG is actively encouraging developers to deploy and test smart contracts. The testnet will feature: A revamped BlockDAG Explorer with real-time contract monitoring Verification tools to authenticate smart contract security Visual dashboards that allow developers to track network performance Community involvement is crucial in this phase, and BlockDAG plans to reward active participants who deploy and stress-test contracts before mainnet launch. Integration with Major Coding Platforms Beyond educational resources, BlockDAG is working on seamless integration with major coding platforms. Developers will be able to access smart contract templates and frameworks through GitHub, simplifying the onboarding process. Additionally, BlockDAG is in discussions to integrate Solidity-based development environments that streamline coding for Ethereum-compatible contracts. This move ensures that experienced blockchain developers can transition to BlockDAG with minimal friction, while newcomers benefit from intuitive tools that reduce technical barriers. BlockDAG Presale Success and Future Outlook BlockDAG’s developer-focused initiatives come at a time when its presale performance is setting records. The latest statistics highlight the project’s rapid growth: Total funds raised: Nearly $200 million Current batch: 27 Batch price: $0.0248 per BDAG Total BDAG coins sold: Over 18.5 billion ROI since batch 1: 2,380% These figures underscore investor confidence in the project, with the team’s commitment to onboarding developers only reinforcing its long-term vision. Looking Ahead BlockDAG’s strategic push for developer engagement positions it as a strong contender in blockchain adoption. By funding projects, simplifying smart contract deployment, and offering structured educational programs, the network is laying the foundation for a thriving ecosystem. With testnet incentives on the horizon and upcoming exchange listings, BlockDAG is setting the stage for widespread adoption. Developers looking to be part of an actively growing network now have access to resources that will support them every step of the way. title: PayPal Expands PYUSD Stablecoin Integration to Serve 20 Million Merchants
body: The post PayPal Expands PYUSD Stablecoin Integration to Serve 20 Million Merchants appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News As per a latest Bloomberg Report, Payments behemoth PayPal is expanding its PYUSD stablecoin integration across more products this year with an aim to serve its 20 million merchants. The move will allow merchants to easily pay and receive payments in stablecoin through a new bill-pay feature. The plans were revealed during PayPal’s annual investor day, unveiling its new merchant product launches and offerings. Michelle Gill, who leads PayPal’s small business and financial services unit, explained that the goal is to help merchants onboard more vendors for seamless transactions. She emphasized that PYUSD would reduce currency conversion fees and payment delays. “A lot of the payments we’re expecting are going to be cross-border because merchants in the US are seeking to pay vendors and suppliers abroad,” she noted. Besides, PayPal plans to integrate PYUSD stablecoin into Hyperwallet this year. Hyperwallet, one of PayPal’s key acquisitions, allows businesses to send payments to freelancers, contractors, and sellers worldwide. Marc Boiron, CEO of Polygon Labs, highlighted that stablecoins are booming with a current market cap of $216.26 billion, thanks in part to platforms like PayPal making them easier to use. Last October, PayPal completed its first transaction with its own stablecoin, showcasing its potential in commercial transactions. Jose Fernandez da Ponte, PayPal’s senior VP of crypto, pointed out that the transaction highlighted other crypto use cases, noting that the speed and availability of settlement make it more attractive. He also mentioned that the current US administration is “very good for crypto” and that the US will soon catch up with the rest of the world. By September 2024, PayPal’s PYUSD stablecoin crossed the $1 billion market cap, less than a year after its launch.

title: Will Bitcoin ETF Outflows Trigger Further Crypto Market Crash?
body: Spot Bitcoin ETFs in the United States have recorded six consecutive days of outflows highlighting a sharp drop in institutional interest. On Tuesday, the net outflows stood at a staggering $937 million, marking the biggest single-day outflows since inception. The outflows have escalated as BTC price loses its crucial support levels falling all the way under $88,500 while extending its weekly losses to more than 7.52%, leading to an overall crypto market crash. Bitcoin ETF Outflows Shake Investor Sentiment Amid the crypto market crash and BTC price losing crucial support levels, US Bitcoin ETFs have witnessed a surge in outflows over the past week. The Bitcoin exchange-traded product (ETP) market experienced its largest-ever single-day net outflow, with 14,579 BTC withdrawn globally, according to Velte Lunde, Head of Research at K33 Research. Source: K33 Research Lunde further added that the ETFs have faced sustained selling pressure throughout February with 69% of the month’s trading days seeing net outflows. This trend underscores a consistent reduction in investor exposure to Bitcoin ETFs, reflecting cautious market sentiment amid broader crypto market volatility. On Tuesday, Fidelity’s FBTC led the total ETF outflows with $344 million while BlackRock’s IBIT saw $144 million in outflows, as per data from Farside Investors . Fidelity has also recorded outflows for six consecutive days in a row. Investors have pulled $1.7 billion from cryptocurrency exchange-traded products (ETPs) and exchange-traded funds (ETFs) this week so far. Bitcoin Exchange Inflows Surge, BTC Price Crash to $70K Imminent? CryptoQuant analyst Amr Taha reported a notable spike in Bitcoin exchange activity, with the “Exchange Inflow (Top 10)” metric exceeding 5,000 BTC three times in a single day following the release of the U.S. Consumer Confidence report. Consumer confidence in the U.S. has dropped to an eight-month low, driven by growing concerns over inflation and the impact of new tariffs introduced under the second Trump administration. The increased inflows suggest potential selling pressure as large holders or institutions may be moving Bitcoin to exchanges for liquidation. This could potentially trigger further outflows from Bitcoin ETFs ahead. Source: CryptoQuant BitMEX co-founder Arthur Hayes has suggested that Bitcoin could retrace to pre-election levels between $70,000 and $75,000 if former President Donald Trump fails to pass his proposed budget, which includes increased spending and a debt ceiling hike. “This is a test of how strong Trump’s hold is on the Republican Party,” Hayes stated, advising market participants to “chill out, retrace, and wait” as the situation unfolds. As of press time, BTC price is trading at $88,488 with daily trading volumes dropping to $68 billion. The post Will Bitcoin ETF Outflows Trigger Further Crypto Market Crash? appeared first on CoinGape .
tags: 24/7 Cryptocurrency News|Bitcoin News|Bitcoin (BTC) Price|Bitcoin ETF|Bitcoin ETF outflows

title: BTC Price Calms at $89K After Tuesday Massacre, XRP Recovers 8% Daily (Market Watch)
body: After losing over ten grand within a day, bitcoin’s price movements have calmed in the past several hours, and the asset stands at around $89,000. Many altcoins have turned green now but are still deep in the red compared to the valuations since this weekend. BTC Calms at $89K It was less than a week ago, on Friday when the primary cryptocurrency was preparing for a charge of $100,000 after gaining over five grand since the Tuesday dip. However, no such challenge actually occurred as Bybit was compromised in what became the largest crypto hack ever, with $1.4 billion stolen. BTC reacted immediately with a drop to $95,000 within hours. After recovering some ground during the weekend to around $96,500, the landscape changed for the worse on Monday and especially on Tuesday. Within the span of just 24 hours or so, the cryptocurrency went from $96,000 to $86,000, losing ten grand in the process. This became one of its most violent price corrections and pushed its valuation to the lowest levels in over three months – erasing lots of the gains charted after Trump’s presidential victory. You can check some of the potential reasons behind this crash here . Since then, BTC has been able to rebound slightly and now sits quietly at $89,000. Its market capitalization, which shed over $150 billion in a day, is now at just over $1.760 trillion on CG. Its dominance over the alts has shrunk by almost 1% to 57.9%. BTCUSD. Source: TradingView Alts Bounce-Off The alternative coins suffered even more yesterday, but many have bounced off on a daily scale now. Ethereum, which dumped to $2,300, is up challenging $2,500 after a 4% daily increase. BNB is up to $630, while SOL is above $140. Even more impressive daily gains come from the likes of XRP, which has added 8.5% and sits north of $2.3, DOGE, ADA, LINK, XLM, AVAX, LTCO, SUI, TON, SHIB, HBAR, HYPE, and many others. The total crypto market cap, which went down by over $300 billion within a day, is now above $3.050 trillion after recovering $100 billion. Cryptocurrency Market Overview. Source: QuantifyCrypto The post BTC Price Calms at $89K After Tuesday Massacre, XRP Recovers 8% Daily (Market Watch) appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Bitcoin's Tuesday Bloodbath Was the Bottom, Analyst Says
body: The crypto market experienced a severe downturn on Tuesday, and according to many on-chain metrics marked a bottom in bitcoin's (BTC) price. The total crypto market capitalization hovered just above $2.7 trillion—marking a nearly $1 trillion wipeout since its peak in December 2024, according to TradingView data. Several indicators suggest that Tuesday's sell-off may have marked a local bottom. Andre Dragosch , Head of Research at Bitwise Europe, highlighted that the Crypto Asset Sentiment Index hit its lowest level since August, coinciding with the unwinding of the yen carry trade, which saw bitcoin make a bottom at around $49,000. "The Crypto Asset Sentiment Index just flashed a massive contrarian buy signal for Bitcoin. Widespread bearishness across flows, on-chain data, and derivatives suggests that downside risks are fairly limited. At these prices, the risk-reward outlook appears quite favorable," Dragosch noted. On Tuesday, investors lost $1.8 billion — the largest single-day realized loss since August — when the yen carry trade unwind resulted in $3.2 billion in realized losses, according to Glassnode data. Additionally, short-term holders, defined by Glassnode as investors who have held bitcoin for less than 155 days, sent 43,600 BTC ($3.9 billion) to exchanges at a loss— the highest level since August 2024. These metrics are crucial in identifying potential market bottoms, suggesting that bitcoin may be nearing a key turning point.

title: XRP Keeps Rally Hope Alive as Price Holds 38.2% Fibonacci Level, DOGE Uptrend Ends
body: Payments-focused cryptocurrency XRP is down but not out, whereas the outlook for dogecoin ( DOGE ) appears grim, based on an analysis of Fibonacci retracement levels. XRP reached a peak of $3.40 in mid-January and has since entered a downtrend, with the price dropping 25% this month to $2.28, according to data from TradingView and CoinDesk. While the sell-off has been steep, it corresponds to only a 38.2% Fibonacci retracement of the rally that started at Nov. 4's low of 49.5 cents through the Jan. 16 high of $3.40. A retracement is a drop from the principal trend. That's positive news for XRP bulls, as that level, along with the 50% and 61.8% ratios, indicates potential areas for the price to resume its previous trend, according to the CME's explainer . Trends often pull back to these levels before initiating larger rallies. That means XRP bulls have reason to be optimistic about potential gains ahead. Moreover, there has been some positive news flow regarding XRP recently. On Monday, ETF.com said Brazil's securities regulator had registered the first spot XRP exchange-traded fund (ETF) as the Hashdex Nasdaq XRP Fund entered a so-called pre-operational phase with Brazil's Comissão de Valores Mobiliários (CVM). U.S. regulators are also reviewing applications for XRP ETFs. A potential approval could accelerate institutional demand for XRP if the uptake of bitcoin ( BTC ) and ether ( ETH ) ETFs is any guide. The Fibonacci series comprises adding the two preceding numbers to find the next number. The sequence, which has been of interest to mathematicians and scientists for centuries, occurs in the following manner: 1, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21, 34, 55, and so on. The ratio of any number to the next higher number is close to 0.618 and if you divide any number in the sequence by the one two spaces to the right, you get 38.2. Traders use these ratios and the 50% level to predict how far an asset might retrace the primary trend, in XRP's case, the bull run. It's a different story for dogecoin because a primary trend is considered to have ended when a retracement exceeds the 61.8% level. The world's largest meme cryptocurrency by market value has dropped below 21 cents, retracing more than 70% of the rally marked by October lows near 10 cents and a high of 48.4 cents in December.

title: Experts Question Whether Altcoin ETFs Will Attract Strong Demand
body: While asset managers are still optimistic, experts like Katalin Tischhauser and Bryan Armour argue that institutional investors may prefer broader crypto index funds over standalone altcoin ETFs. Despite this, firms like Grayscale and 21Shares are actively seeking approval for ETFs tied to Polkadot, Solana, and other altcoins. Meanwhile, market sentiment is currently very cautious, and CryptoQuant’s Ki Young Ju even suggested that an ”altcoin season” as most people know it is unlikely to take place in 2025. Altcoin ETFs Face Uncertain Demand The introduction of exchange-traded funds (ETFs) holding alternative cryptos in the United States may not attract a lot of investor interest, despite asset managers filing multiple applications. While analysts expect regulatory approval for some of these ETFs in 2025, demand is expected to be much lower than that for Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs. A crypto ETF is a regulated investment vehicle that allows investors to gain exposure to cryptocurrencies without directly holding the underlying assets. These ETFs trade on traditional stock exchanges and track the price of a specific cryptocurrency or a basket of digital assets. Investment analysts suggest that institutional investors, who were previously hesitant to invest in Bitcoin and Ethereum before the ETF structure was introduced, are unlikely to show the same level of interest in altcoin ETFs. Katalin Tischhauser , head of research at Sygnum, pointed out that the market excitement surrounding altcoin ETFs does not seem to be backed by clear evidence of strong demand. She estimates that inflows for altcoin ETFs may range from several hundred million to $1 billion, which is a stark contrast to the over $100 billion held by US Bitcoin ETFs. Bryan Armour , the director of passive strategies research at Morningstar agrees with this, and stated that many investors who are familiar with altcoins like Solana and Dogecoin already hold these assets through spot exchanges or on-chain. He believes that institutional investors are more likely to gain exposure to altcoins through index funds that passively track the broader cryptocurrency market rather than through standalone altcoin ETFs. Recent developments in the crypto ETF space suggest a preference for more established assets. Franklin Templeton and Hashdex both launched crypto index ETFs that currently hold only Bitcoin and Ethereum, though they may expand to include other assets pending regulatory approval. Despite the skepticism from analysts, asset managers preparing to launch altcoin ETFs are still very optimistic. Research by JPMorgan suggests that cumulative demand for these products could exceed $14 billion. Federico Brokate, head of US operations at 21Shares, argues that even experienced crypto investors stand to benefit from holding altcoins in an ETF wrapper due to institutional pricing and secure custody. He also shared that independent registered investment advisors (RIAs) are increasingly considering altcoin ETFs as a way to differentiate their portfolios. The adoption of crypto ETFs follows a pattern, according to Matt Horne, head of digital asset strategists at Fidelity Investments. Just as Bitcoin ETFs saw early adopters before gaining wider acceptance, altcoin ETFs may experience a gradual adoption process over time. While the initial demand for these funds is expected to be quite limited, the market could evolve as more investors recognize the potential benefits of holding altcoins in an ETF structure. Grayscale Seeks Approval for Polkadot ETF One of the latest developments surrounding altcoin ETFs happened when Nasdaq recently filed a request to list a Grayscale ETF that will hold Polkadot’s native token, DOT. If approved, the Grayscale Polkadot Trust will join the asset manager’s growing portfolio of publicly traded crypto funds. This filing is one of many currently under review by the SEC as exchanges and asset managers seek approval for ETFs tied to altcoins. Grayscale’s DOT ETF application (Source: Nasdaq ) Grayscale already lists two spot Bitcoin ETFs and a spot Ethereum ETF, and is looking for regulatory approval for ETFs holding Solana, Litecoin, XRP, Dogecoin, and Cardano. The firm also wants to launch an ETF that holds a diversified basket of cryptocurrencies. Beyond ETFs, Grayscale manages several single-asset crypto funds that are not publicly traded. Earlier this year, it introduced investment funds for the Pyth Network’s native token and Dogecoin. In late 2023, the company launched investment funds for Lido and Optimism’s governance tokens. The push for crypto ETFs has intensified, and multiple asset managers are seeking approval to list funds tied to a range of altcoins. Among them, 21Shares has also submitted an application for a Polkadot ETF. Other proposed funds include ETFs for Hedera and Official Trump. In addition to new listings, issuers are awaiting regulatory decisions on proposed changes to existing ETFs, like allowances for staking, options trading, and in-kind redemptions. The SEC’s stance on cryptocurrency regulation shifted a lot in recent months, particularly after Donald Trump’s re-election. Under the Biden administration, the SEC took aggressive action against crypto firms by initiating more than 100 lawsuits related to securities law violations. While spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs received approval in 2024, ETFs tied to other cryptocurrencies faced resistance. However, analysts at Bloomberg Intelligence estimate that the likelihood of an XRP ETF gaining approval in the US is about 65%, with Litecoin and Solana ETFs having even stronger odds at 90% and 70%, respectively. Altcoin Season Unlikely in 2025… In addition to reduced interest in altcoin ETFs, the widespread rally known as ”altcoin season” may not materialize in 2025. However, cryptocurrencies with strong fundamentals and revenue-generating models could still outperform the broader market, according to CryptoQuant CEO Ki Young Ju . He believes that most altcoins are unlikely to survive the next market cycle, and stated that “the era of everything pumping is over.” However, projects with potential ETF approvals, consistent revenue streams, and sustained investor interest may stand out. Ju’s assessment was made as nearly a quarter of the 200 largest cryptocurrencies hit their lowest levels in over a year, which raised some concerns about a potential market capitulation. This decline also led to speculation that the market could be approaching a bottom before the next upward trend. Juan Pellicer , a senior research analyst at IntoTheBlock, pointed to the recent market correction as a possible sign of capitulation. The drop in total crypto market cap to $2.93 trillion and massive liquidations, particularly in assets like Solana, indicate that overleveraged positions are being flushed out. In financial markets, capitulation happens when investors panic-sell their holdings, leading to a steep decline in prices before the market stabilizes and begins to recover. While some assets may struggle in the current environment, Ju suggests that investors should focus more on cryptocurrencies with clear utility and strong financial models rather than hoping for a broad-based altcoin rally. Overall, it seems like the projects that can sustain long-term interest and institutional backing may be the ones that thrive.

title: South Africa’s DeFi sector to reach $180 million by 2028, the study finds
body: While Africa is often seen as the cradle of crypto adoption, the largest economy on the continent, South Africa, is one of the leading countries in the region in terms of crypto adoption and regulation. The new report published by the local financial regulator highlights the bright prospects for the South African DeFi sector. Table of Contents The goal of the study The numbers South Africa as a significant nascent crypto hub The goal of the study On Feb. 20, 2025, the Financial Sector Conduct Authority released a study called Market Study on Decentralized Finance (DeFi) in South Africa. The study is based on a survey of crypto asset service providers and aims to assist local regulators to better understand the role of DeFi in South Africa. The timing is important as South Africa has become one of the world’s leading countries in the DeFi sector in the 2020s. As the sector itself is already shaping the country’s economic outlook, clearer regulation is in demand, particularly when it comes to the relationship between the banks and crypto asset service providers. According to the study, the estimated annual revenue of the South African DeFi sector is $2.8 million. The main players in the market are retail clients (71%), followed by small and medium-sized enterprises. The key factors behind the sector growth identified in the study are financial inclusion facilitated by DeFi, low transaction costs, and transparency. The growing significance of the DeFi sector in the local economy brings new risks. The study points them out, citing price manipulation, security breaches of smart contracts, potential platform failures, and fraud as the main threats associated with decentralized finance. The risks outlined in the study include custody risk, oracle risk, liquidity risk, and many more. The study suggests that regulations should factor these risks in to ensure users’ protection. Respondents believe that the main ways to protect users are associated with improved regulation and educational efforts aimed to elevate the financial literacy of the residents. The numbers More than a third of respondents believe that the South African DeFi sector TVL exceeds $27 million, which is not a huge share of the global total but is still significant in the region. Moreover, it is growing rapidly. The overall DeFi market in South Africa is projected to reach $180 million by 2028. The study reveals the top use cases for DeFi in South Africa. More than half of respondents use crypto for payments, with lending and borrowing coming in second at 47.6%. A third of respondents use decentralized exchanges, and only 14.2% say they use stablecoins. Staking, asset management, and tokenization are three other popular responses. These responses show that the DeFi sector in South Africa is providing banking and remittance opportunities for residents while serving as a tokenization channel for traditional finance players. Respondents provided an outlook on the market drivers in the country, citing increasing adoption by mainstream investors (62%), the emergence of new DeFi protocols (43%), the unbanked population (33%), and the declaration of crypto as financial products (29%) as the main factors. You might also like: South African Financial Sector Regulator Declares Crypto Assets a Financial Product In general, it’s safe to say that despite the name (Decentralised Finance in South Africa), the report is largely focused on describing the DeFi sector per se so that the regulators (the report’s main audience) would know better how to deal with the growing sector. South Africa as a significant nascent crypto hub Sub-Saharan Africa, in general, is a region where the crypto sector is growing rapidly, largely because cryptocurrencies have met the unfulfilled demand for financial inclusion. South Africa, as one of the leading economies on the continent, has become one of the most important crypto hubs in Africa. The local crypto sector saw important changes in the 2020s as the government implemented a series of crypto-friendly laws. Most importantly, in October 2022, the Financial Sector Conduct Authority declared crypto to be a financial product, making it legal to use cryptocurrency in South Africa, although the ruling didn’t grant crypto a legal tender status. In general, the favorable legal climate has made South Africa one of the nascent crypto hubs in the region and in the world as well. Local crypto asset service providers are institutions regulated under the Financial Intelligence Centre Act. The AML rules are mandatory for the CASPs operating in South Africa. To control the cross-border movement of value, the country adopted a Travel Rule for crypto assets. It will come into effect from April 2025. According to Chainanalysis , the South African crypto market was valued at $26 billion in 2023. Last year’s trends included the growing interest from institutional investors seeking custody solutions in the decentralized finance sector. Reflecting the overall African trend of using crypto for everyday payments, the circulation of stablecoins in South Africa outperformed Bitcoin in 2023. The experts from the local crypto industry claim that the elections scheduled for May of 2025 won’t affect a friendly crypto regulatory climate. You might also like: Crypto policies won’t be affected by South African elections, insiders say

title: Urgent Call for Fair Crypto Regulation: Circle Fights for Equitable Stablecoin Laws Amidst Tether ‘Kill’ Claims
body: In the ever-evolving world of digital currencies, a crucial debate is brewing around the regulation of stablecoins. Imagine a financial landscape where innovation thrives, but within a framework that ensures fairness and stability. This is the vision Circle, the issuer of USDC, is championing. Let’s dive into the heart of this discussion and explore why Circle is advocating for equitable crypto regulation , not just in the U.S., but globally, and what Tether’s CEO has to say about the competitive landscape. Why Equitable Crypto Regulation for Stablecoins Matters Now? Dante Disparte, Chief Strategy Officer at Circle, recently articulated a pressing need for the United States to establish crypto regulation that treats all stablecoin issuers fairly, regardless of their location. In an interview with The Information, Disparte emphasized that a level playing field is essential to foster growth and ensure continued access to vital banking and regulatory systems for these burgeoning financial instruments. But why is this so critical right now? Global Competition is Heating Up: Disparte anticipates a surge in global competition among stablecoin providers. Fair regulations can prevent a regulatory race to the bottom and ensure that innovation is driven by product quality and utility, not just by exploiting regulatory loopholes. Fostering Innovation: Equitable laws can encourage innovation within the stablecoins sector. When companies feel confident that the rules are fair and consistently applied, they are more likely to invest in developing better products and services. Protecting Consumers: Consistent regulatory standards, whether for U.S. or overseas entities, are vital for consumer protection. This ensures that all stablecoins operating within or serving the U.S. market adhere to similar safety and transparency standards. Maintaining U.S. Leadership: By establishing clear and equitable crypto regulation , the U.S. can maintain its leadership in the global financial landscape. A well-defined framework can attract innovation and investment in the digital asset space. The Tether Factor: Is it Really a ‘Kill Tether’ Strategy? While Circle advocates for fair crypto regulation , the landscape is undeniably competitive, and perhaps even adversarial, according to some. Paolo Ardoino, CEO of Tether, the issuer of USDT, recently took to X (formerly Twitter) to express his perspective on the competitive dynamics. He claims that while competitors should ideally focus on building superior products and expanding their distribution networks, their “real intent is ‘Kill Tether.’” Ardoino suggests that this view is widely held by insiders and observers who interact with the U.S. government. This paints a picture of a highly charged environment where competition isn’t just about market share but potentially about the very survival of certain digital assets . Tether vs. USDC: A Tale of Two Stablecoins The contrasting statements from Circle and Tether highlight the complex dynamics within the stablecoins market. Let’s break down some key differences and points of contention: Feature USDC (Circle) USDT (Tether) Issuer Transparency Circle provides regular attestation reports and is more transparent about its reserves. Tether has faced criticism for its reserve transparency, although it has increased transparency over time. Regulatory Compliance Circle is actively engaging with regulators and is committed to full compliance. Tether has faced regulatory scrutiny and questions regarding its compliance in various jurisdictions. Reserve Composition USDC reserves are primarily held in cash and short-term U.S. government bonds. USDT reserves have included a wider range of assets, including commercial paper, corporate bonds, and others. Market Capitalization USDC has a significant market cap but is generally lower than USDT. USDT consistently holds the largest market capitalization among stablecoins . Key Focus Advocating for clear and equitable crypto regulation to foster growth and stability. Navigating regulatory challenges while maintaining market dominance and defending against perceived competitive threats. Actionable Insights: Navigating the Evolving Stablecoin Landscape For those involved in the cryptocurrency space, whether as investors, developers, or policymakers, understanding these dynamics is crucial. Here are some actionable insights: Stay Informed on Regulatory Developments: Crypto regulation is a rapidly changing field. Keep abreast of the latest developments in the U.S. and globally. Follow regulatory bodies like the SEC, CFTC, and international organizations like the Financial Stability Board (FSB). Understand Stablecoin Risks and Transparency: Do your due diligence on different stablecoins . Understand their reserve composition, transparency practices, and regulatory compliance status. Not all stablecoins are created equal. Support Constructive Dialogue: Encourage and participate in constructive conversations about crypto regulation . Engage with industry associations, participate in public consultations, and voice your opinions to policymakers. Consider Diversification: In a competitive and potentially volatile market, diversification can be a prudent strategy. Consider using a mix of different digital assets and stablecoins based on your risk tolerance and investment goals. Advocate for Fair Rules: Support initiatives and organizations that advocate for clear, fair, and equitable crypto regulation that fosters innovation and protects consumers. The Future of Stablecoins: A Battle for Fair Play? The contrasting narratives from Circle and Tether underscore a pivotal moment for stablecoins . Circle’s call for equitable crypto regulation reflects a desire for a stable and predictable environment that fosters long-term growth and innovation. Tether’s concerns about a ‘Kill Tether’ strategy highlight the intense competitive pressures and regulatory scrutiny facing the sector. Ultimately, the future of stablecoins will be shaped by how regulators respond to these calls and how effectively the industry can navigate the complex interplay of competition and compliance. The quest for fair and effective crypto regulation is not just about the survival of individual companies; it’s about shaping the very foundation of the future digital economy. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Insightful Forecast: Crypto Expert Declares End to Memecoin Craze, Predicts Bitcoin and DeFi Resurgence
body: The wild ride of memecoins might be approaching its final loop-de-loop! According to Matt Hougan, the Chief Investment Officer (CIO) of Bitwise, a leading crypto index fund manager, the reign of meme-based cryptocurrencies is likely to conclude within the next six months. Is this the beginning of a new era for the crypto market , shifting away from fleeting trends and towards more sustainable growth? Is the Memecoin Craze Fading? Expert Insights In a recent post on X (formerly Twitter), Hougan highlighted the struggles of certain memecoins, including MELANIA and LIBRA, as indicators of a broader market shift. He pointed out that these tokens, once riding high on hype, are now facing headwinds. MELANIA, associated with the former U.S. First Lady, and LIBRA, entangled in controversy with Argentine President Javier Milei, are symbolic of the speculative frenzy that often fuels the memecoin craze . Adding fuel to the fire, Hougan also mentioned the notorious North Korean hacker group Lazarus. Known for their sophisticated cybercrimes, including the Bybit hack, Lazarus is reportedly using memecoins as a novel method to launder stolen Ethereum (ETH). This adds a layer of complexity and risk to the already volatile memecoin landscape. Here’s a quick rundown of the factors contributing to the potential decline of the memecoin boom: Market Saturation: The sheer number of memecoins flooding the market dilutes attention and investment, making it harder for individual coins to gain traction and maintain hype. Regulatory Scrutiny: As the crypto market matures, regulators are increasingly paying attention to all sectors, including memecoins, potentially leading to stricter rules and compliance requirements. Investor Fatigue: The get-rich-quick allure of memecoins can wear off as investors experience volatility and potential losses, seeking more fundamentally sound investments. Focus on Utility: The crypto narrative is gradually shifting towards real-world utility and applications, pushing aside purely speculative assets like many memecoins. Beyond Memes: The Promising Future of the Crypto Market While predicting the end of the memecoin craze , Hougan’s outlook for the broader crypto ecosystem remains decidedly optimistic. He emphasizes several key areas poised for significant growth, suggesting a more mature and robust future for the industry. Let’s delve into these positive catalysts: The Power of Bitcoin Adoption Hougan is particularly bullish on the continued institutional adoption of Bitcoin (BTC) . This isn’t just about retail investors anymore; major financial institutions, corporations, and even governments are increasingly recognizing Bitcoin’s potential as a store of value and a legitimate asset class. Why is institutional Bitcoin adoption a game-changer? Increased Legitimacy: Institutional investment brings credibility and mainstream acceptance to Bitcoin and the entire crypto space. Larger Capital Inflows: Institutions manage vast amounts of capital, and their entry into Bitcoin can inject significant liquidity into the market, driving growth and stability. Long-Term Investment Horizon: Unlike retail investors who might be swayed by short-term market fluctuations, institutions often have a longer-term investment horizon, fostering stability and sustainable growth. The Rise of Stablecoins: Stability in a Volatile World Stablecoins , cryptocurrencies pegged to a stable asset like the US dollar, are becoming increasingly crucial for the crypto ecosystem. Hougan highlights their growing importance, and for good reason. Benefits of Stablecoins: Benefit Description Reduced Volatility Stablecoins offer a refuge from the price swings inherent in other cryptocurrencies, making them ideal for transactions and preserving value. Efficient Transactions They enable fast and low-cost transactions, especially for international transfers, without the volatility risk of other cryptos. DeFi Integration Stablecoins are the backbone of many Decentralized Finance (DeFi) applications, facilitating lending, borrowing, and yield farming activities. Tokenization: Unlocking New Asset Classes Tokenization , the process of representing real-world assets like real estate, art, or commodities as digital tokens on a blockchain, is another area Hougan is excited about. This innovative approach has the potential to revolutionize various industries. The Promise of Tokenization: Increased Liquidity: Tokenization can make traditionally illiquid assets more easily tradable and accessible to a wider range of investors. Fractional Ownership: It allows for fractional ownership of high-value assets, democratizing investment opportunities. Enhanced Transparency and Efficiency: Blockchain-based tokenization provides transparency and streamlines processes like asset transfer and management. DeFi Resurgence: The Future of Finance? Despite past setbacks and challenges, Hougan anticipates a strong DeFi resurgence . Decentralized Finance aims to recreate traditional financial services like lending, borrowing, and trading in a decentralized, transparent, and accessible manner using blockchain technology. Why DeFi is Poised for a Comeback: Technological Advancements: Improvements in blockchain technology, scalability solutions, and security protocols are making DeFi platforms more robust and user-friendly. Growing User Base: As more people become comfortable with crypto and seek alternatives to traditional finance, DeFi adoption is likely to increase. Innovation and Evolution: The DeFi space is constantly innovating, developing new protocols, and addressing past vulnerabilities, paving the way for a more mature and sustainable ecosystem. Navigating the Transition: A Word of Caution While optimistic about the long-term prospects, Hougan also cautions that the crypto market might experience a period of slowdown before these positive trends fully materialize. The transition from a memecoin-driven frenzy to a more fundamentally sound market takes time. Until institutional adoption, stablecoin usage, tokenization, and DeFi fully gain momentum, the market could experience some growing pains. Actionable Insights for Crypto Enthusiasts: Focus on Fundamentals: Shift your attention from hype-driven memecoins to projects with real utility, strong teams, and solid technology. Diversify Your Portfolio: Don’t put all your eggs in one basket. Diversify across different asset classes within the crypto space, including Bitcoin, stablecoins, and promising DeFi projects. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of market trends, regulatory developments, and technological advancements in the crypto space. Manage Risk: Understand the risks involved in crypto investing and invest responsibly, only what you can afford to lose. Conclusion: A New Chapter for Crypto Matt Hougan’s forecast paints a picture of a crypto market at a turning point. The potential end of the memecoin craze could signal a healthy shift towards more sustainable growth drivers like institutional Bitcoin adoption , the utility of stablecoins , the innovation of tokenization , and the resurgence of DeFi . While a period of market adjustment might be on the horizon, the long-term outlook for the crypto space appears bright, promising a more mature, robust, and impactful future. The era of fleeting hype might be fading, but the era of real crypto innovation is just beginning. title: Ethereum explores migration to Poseidon hash function ahead of Pectra upgrade
body: Vitalik Buterin has called on researchers to join the Poseidon cryptographic analysis program as Ethereum explores the potential switch to the Poseidon hash function to enhance its zk-proof capabilities. In his recent post on X , Vitalik Buterin, a co-founder of Ethereum ( ETH ), has encouraged researchers to join the Poseidon cryptographic analysis program. Vitalik is considering switching to the Poseidon hash function to improve how it works with zk-provers (tools for verifying transactions privately). To help make this decision, Ethereum wants more information about Poseidon’s security, and they’ve extended the deadline to apply for the funding program to March 15. Highly encourage researchers to participate in the Poseidon cryptanalysis program. We are seriously considering migrating Ethereum to the Poseidon hash to optimize zk-prover friendliness, so having more information about its security properties is extremely high value. https://t.co/AhbV8abD4z — vitalik.eth (@VitalikButerin) February 26, 2025 In Nov. 2022, a proposal called Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 5988 was introduced, suggesting adding a precompiled contract to the Ethereum Virtual Machine to implement the Poseidon hash function, aiming to enhance interoperability between the EVM and zero-knowledge rollups. You might also like: What is Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)? A deep dive Since the proposal’s introduction, it seems there hasn’t been any official implementation or major update to EIP 5988, but it looks like Ethereum is still seriously considering implementing Poseidon. The Poseidon hash function , introduced in 2019, is relatively new compared to well-established hash functions like SHA-256 and Keccak, which have been around for decades and have undergone extensive testing. However, SHA-256 or Keccakt aren’t specifically designed for zero-knowledge proofs. In contrast, Poseidon has specifically been designed for use in zero-knowledge proofs. Although it hasn’t been as extensively tested as SHA-256 and Keccak, Poseidon is already in use in production within layer-2 systems on the Ethereum network and other blockchain projects. Ethereum’s exploration of the Poseidon hash function is just a small part of its broader efforts to enhance the network’s performance. Most notably, the long-awaited Pectra upgrade will officially launch on April 8, aiming to enhance Ethereum’s scalability, improve account abstraction, boost layer-2 efficiency, and increase validator rewards. This upgrade follows the recent Dencun hard fork—which rolled out in March 2024, significantly slashing transaction fees for layer-2 networks. You might also like: Ethereum Pectra upgrade scheduled for mainnet on April 8

title: Oklahoma Greenlights Bitcoin Reserve Bill: A Bold Leap into Crypto Future
body: Exciting news for crypto enthusiasts! Oklahoma is taking a potentially groundbreaking step into the world of digital assets. The Oklahoma House committee has just given the nod to a bill that could see Bitcoin (BTC) recognized as a strategic reserve asset. This move signals a significant shift in how states might approach cryptocurrency, and it’s definitely something to keep your eye on. Let’s dive into what this all means. Oklahoma House Committee Approves Landmark BTC Reserve Bill In a decisive move, the Oklahoma House committee has voted in favor of a bill that proposes to classify Bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset. According to crypto media outlet Solid Intel, the bill sailed through the committee with a strong 12 votes in favor. This is a major win for proponents of cryptocurrency adoption and could pave the way for other states to follow suit. The bill, championed by U.S. Representative Cody Maynard, was initially introduced in January and has been steadily gaining momentum. If enacted, it would grant the Oklahoma state government the authority to allocate up to 10% of its public funds into Bitcoin and other digital assets. This isn’t just a symbolic gesture; it’s a concrete step towards integrating digital currencies into the state’s financial strategy. Before reaching this stage, the bill had already cleared another hurdle, securing six favorable votes from the U.S. Committee on Banking, Financial Services and Pensions. With this latest committee approval, the legislation is now poised for a crucial vote before the full House. The crypto community is watching closely, eager to see if Oklahoma will become a pioneer in embracing Bitcoin as a state-level reserve asset. Why is Oklahoma Considering Bitcoin as a Strategic Asset? So, what’s driving Oklahoma’s interest in Bitcoin? Several factors could be at play. Firstly, there’s a growing recognition of Bitcoin’s potential as a store of value and a hedge against inflation. As traditional financial systems face uncertainties, alternative assets like Bitcoin are gaining traction. Secondly, states are likely exploring ways to diversify their investment portfolios and potentially enhance returns. Bitcoin, despite its volatility, has shown significant growth over the long term, and a strategic allocation could be seen as a forward-thinking financial move. Here are some potential benefits of Oklahoma designating Bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset: Diversification of State Funds: Bitcoin’s low correlation with traditional assets like stocks and bonds can offer diversification benefits to the state’s investment portfolio, potentially reducing overall risk. Potential for Higher Returns: While not guaranteed, Bitcoin has historically outperformed many traditional assets over longer periods, offering the potential for increased returns on state investments. Attracting Innovation and Technology: Embracing Bitcoin can position Oklahoma as a tech-forward state, potentially attracting blockchain and cryptocurrency businesses and talent. Future-Proofing Finances: As digital assets gain prominence, integrating Bitcoin into state reserves can be seen as a proactive step to adapt to the evolving financial landscape. Navigating the Challenges: What are the Hurdles Ahead? Of course, adopting Bitcoin as a reserve asset isn’t without its challenges. Cryptocurrency adoption , especially at the governmental level, comes with considerations that need careful attention. Volatility Concerns: Bitcoin’s price volatility is a significant concern for any entity managing public funds. Risk management strategies would be crucial to mitigate potential losses. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving. States need to navigate complex legal and compliance issues when dealing with digital assets. Security and Custody: Safeguarding Bitcoin holdings requires robust security measures and secure custody solutions to prevent theft or loss. Public Perception and Education: Educating the public and addressing potential skepticism about Bitcoin is important for ensuring transparency and public trust in this initiative. Examples of Crypto Adoption: Learning from Others While Oklahoma’s move is noteworthy, it’s not happening in isolation. Other regions and even countries are exploring or have already embraced Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies in various ways. For instance: Region/Country Approach to Cryptocurrency Key Highlights El Salvador Bitcoin as Legal Tender First country to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender, aiming to boost financial inclusion and remittances. Switzerland (Zug) Crypto-Friendly Canton Canton of Zug has become a hub for crypto companies, accepting Bitcoin for taxes and public services. Miami, USA Pro-Bitcoin City Initiatives Mayor Francis Suarez has been a vocal Bitcoin advocate, exploring Bitcoin payments for city employees and citizens. These examples demonstrate different levels of cryptocurrency adoption and highlight the diverse ways in which digital assets are being integrated into economies and governance. Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for You? The Oklahoma BTC reserve bill , even if you are not in Oklahoma, carries implications for the broader crypto space and individual investors. Increased Institutional Interest: State-level adoption can signal growing institutional acceptance of Bitcoin, potentially attracting further investment from larger players. Validation of Bitcoin as an Asset Class: Designating Bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset strengthens its legitimacy as a viable asset class beyond just speculative trading. Potential for Regulatory Clarity: As more states and governments engage with cryptocurrencies, it could push for clearer and more consistent regulatory frameworks. Positive Market Sentiment: News like this often contributes to positive sentiment in the crypto market, potentially influencing price action and investor confidence. For individual investors, this development reinforces the narrative of Bitcoin’s increasing mainstream acceptance. While it’s essential to do your own research and understand the risks, moves like Oklahoma’s suggest a potential long-term trend towards greater integration of digital assets into the financial system. Conclusion: A Strategic Move or a Risky Bet? Oklahoma’s strategic asset consideration of Bitcoin is undoubtedly a bold and forward-looking move. Whether it’s a stroke of genius or a risky gamble remains to be seen. However, it’s undeniable that this initiative puts Oklahoma at the forefront of state-level cryptocurrency adoption in the U.S. The full House vote will be a critical juncture, and the outcome will likely have ripple effects across the crypto industry and potentially influence other states’ approaches to digital assets. Keep watching this space – the crypto revolution is unfolding, one legislative step at a time. To learn more about the latest cryptocurrency trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption.

title: Bitcoin's Lofty Max Pain Suggests Higher Spot Prices as $5B Options Expiry Approaches
body: Approximately $5 billion in bitcoin (BTC) options contracts are set to expire on Deribit this Friday at 08:00 UTC, adding to an already volatile crypto market. Bitcoin’s prolonged consolidation had kept Deribit’s volatility index (DVOL) in a downward trend throughout 2025. However, after bitcoin’s sharp decline, DVOL spiked to 52 before retreating back below 50—signaling a temporary surge in market uncertainty. The recent price drop below $90,000 has left a majority of options out-of-the-money (OTM) and traders facing significant unrealized losses. An option allows the holder the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell an underlying asset at a specific price within a certain time period. According to Deribit data , out of the $5 billion of notional value that is due to expire, $3.9 billion (78%) of it is due to expire out-the-money (OTM), meaning these contracts will expire worthless. Almost 100% of calls are OTM, which are bullish bets, as the bitcoin price dropped significantly over the past few days, leaving investors with a significant amount of unrealized losses. While, the remaining $1.1 billion (22%), was in-the-money (ITM) with it being dominated with puts. ITM puts are investors having their strike prices above the spot price, meaning they hold value. However, max pain is at $98,000, that is, $10,000 higher than the current spot price. Max pain is the price at which option sellers, typically institutions, achieve maximum profit, while buyers experience the greatest amount of losses. As the max pain price is so much higher than the spot price, this could incentivize options sellers to push bitcoin price higher closer to the pain level, according to PowerTrade . "With the end of the month approaching, bitcoin options traders should take note. Max Pain for Feb. 28 sits at $98,000, with a massive $5 billion notional value. This means the highest open interest is clustered here, incentivizing market makers to keep bitcoin close to this price. Expect increased volatility and potential price gravitation toward this level," PowerTrade said on X. Let's see if the so-called max pain theory holds true.

title: Bitcoin’s Unstoppable Force: CZ Binance Reassures Market, ‘BTC Won’t Die’
body: In the ever-turbulent world of cryptocurrency, where fortunes can swing wildly with each news cycle, a reassuring voice has emerged from a familiar corner. Changpeng Zhao (CZ), the influential co-founder and former CEO of crypto exchange giant Binance, has stepped forward to deliver a powerful message about the king of cryptocurrencies: Bitcoin (BTC) is here to stay. In a recent post on X (formerly Twitter), CZ declared unequivocally that there’s “no need to panic” because Bitcoin “won’t die.” But what does this statement truly mean in the grand scheme of the crypto market, and why should investors and enthusiasts take note? Why CZ’s Confidence in Bitcoin Matters When a figure as prominent as CZ speaks about the future of Bitcoin , the crypto community listens. His tenure at the helm of Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume, has given him unparalleled insights into market dynamics, investor sentiment, and the underlying strength of various digital assets. CZ’s declaration isn’t just a casual remark; it’s a statement rooted in years of experience navigating the volatile crypto landscape. Here’s why CZ’s words carry weight: Industry Veteran Perspective: CZ has witnessed numerous crypto cycles, including bull runs and bear markets. His experience provides a historical context to current market conditions. Binance’s Market Position: As the former CEO of Binance, CZ has access to vast amounts of market data and user behavior insights, giving him a unique understanding of Bitcoin ‘s role in the broader ecosystem. Influence on Market Sentiment: CZ’s opinions often influence market sentiment. His positive stance on Bitcoin can instill confidence among investors, potentially stabilizing or even boosting market morale. Decoding the ‘Bitcoin Won’t Die’ Statement CZ’s simple yet powerful statement, “ Bitcoin won’t die,” is more than just reassurance; it’s a nod to the fundamental principles and enduring characteristics of Bitcoin that have allowed it to weather numerous storms since its inception in 2009. Let’s break down what makes Bitcoin so resilient: Decentralization: Bitcoin’s decentralized nature is arguably its greatest strength. Unlike traditional currencies controlled by central banks, Bitcoin operates on a distributed ledger across a global network. This decentralization makes it incredibly difficult to shut down or control by any single entity. Scarcity: With a capped supply of 21 million coins, Bitcoin possesses inherent scarcity, similar to gold. This scarcity is a core tenet of its value proposition, acting as a hedge against inflation and currency devaluation. Network Effect: The more people and businesses that adopt Bitcoin , the stronger its network effect becomes. This growing ecosystem enhances its utility, security, and overall value. Technological Foundation: Built on robust blockchain technology, Bitcoin ‘s underlying infrastructure is secure and transparent. Continuous development and upgrades further strengthen its technological foundation. Global Adoption: Bitcoin enjoys global recognition and adoption, transcending geographical boundaries and traditional financial systems. Its accessibility and borderless nature contribute to its staying power. Navigating Crypto Volatility with Confidence The crypto market is notorious for its volatility. Price swings can be dramatic and often influenced by a myriad of factors ranging from regulatory news to macroeconomic trends. In such an environment, maintaining market confidence is crucial. CZ’s statement serves as a reminder of the long-term potential of Bitcoin , encouraging investors to look beyond short-term fluctuations. How can investors navigate crypto volatility with greater confidence? Strategy Description Benefit Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA) Investing a fixed amount of money at regular intervals, regardless of price. Reduces the impact of volatility by averaging out the purchase price over time. Long-Term Investing (HODLing) Holding Bitcoin for the long term, weathering short-term price fluctuations. Capitalizes on the potential for long-term appreciation of Bitcoin ‘s value. Diversification Spreading investments across different cryptocurrencies and asset classes. Reduces risk by not putting all eggs in one basket. Staying Informed Keeping up-to-date with crypto news, market trends, and regulatory developments. Enables informed decision-making and better risk management. The Enduring Appeal of Crypto Resilience The concept of crypto resilience is central to understanding why many believe in the longevity of digital assets like Bitcoin . Resilience in this context refers to the ability of cryptocurrencies to withstand market crashes, regulatory pressures, and technological challenges. Bitcoin has repeatedly demonstrated this resilience throughout its history. Examples of Bitcoin’s resilience: Market Crashes: Bitcoin has survived multiple significant market crashes, each time recovering and often reaching new all-time highs. Regulatory Hurdles: Despite varying regulatory landscapes across the globe, Bitcoin continues to operate and gain acceptance in many jurisdictions. Technological Scrutiny: Bitcoin ‘s technology has been rigorously tested and scrutinized, proving its robustness and security over time. CZ’s recent statement reinforces this narrative of resilience. It’s a reminder that despite the noise and volatility, the fundamental principles and underlying technology of Bitcoin are strong. For those deeply invested in the crypto space, this message is not just comforting; it’s a validation of their long-held beliefs. Actionable Insights: What to Take Away from CZ’s Statement So, what are the key takeaways from CZ’s reassuring words about Bitcoin ? Don’t Panic Sell: Market dips are a normal part of the crypto cycle. CZ’s statement suggests that these dips should be viewed as opportunities rather than reasons to panic and sell. Long-Term Perspective: Focus on the long-term potential of Bitcoin rather than short-term price movements. Bitcoin ‘s fundamentals remain strong, and its long-term trajectory is still promising. Educate Yourself: Continue to learn about Bitcoin , blockchain technology, and the broader crypto market. Informed investors are better equipped to make sound decisions during volatile times. Stay Informed, Stay Calm: Keep abreast of market news and developments, but avoid emotional reactions to price swings. A calm and informed approach is crucial for navigating the crypto market successfully. Conclusion: Bitcoin’s Enduring Legacy Changpeng Zhao’s assertion that Bitcoin “won’t die” is a powerful endorsement of its staying power in the digital age. It’s a message of hope and stability in a market often characterized by uncertainty. While the crypto journey will undoubtedly continue to be filled with twists and turns, the underlying resilience and fundamental strengths of Bitcoin , as highlighted by CZ, offer a compelling reason for long-term optimism. As Bitcoin matures and adoption grows, its role in the future of finance looks increasingly secure, promising a future where digital assets play an integral part in the global economic landscape. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.
